byline.contributor: Niki Kitsantonis reported from Athens and James Kanter from Brussels. Alison Smale contributed reporting from Berlin.
byline.original: By NIKI KITSANTONIS and JAMES KANTER

abstract: Greek officials will propose to eurozone finance ministers four-month extension to its current bailout program; proposal will not include commitment to honor memo underlying loan program, which many Greeks object to; it is unclear whether eurozone officials will find proposal acceptable until it is formally submitted.
lead_paragraph: Athens will push for an extension of several months but will not adhere to an underlying memorandum that prescribed many austerity measures.

headline.main: Greece to Propose Extension of European Union Bailout Program
headline.print_headline: Greece to Propose Extension of European Union Bailout Program

snippet: Athens will push for an extension of several months but will not adhere to an underlying memorandum that prescribed many austerity measures.
